chapter.title: Reporting
chapter.para: The Reporting tab offers six types of reports. The results are formatted as tables in the application central interface.

sect1.title: Loans
sect1.para: The Loans sub-menu enables you to access data about your library's collection. You can display :

listitem.para: the list of items on loan with due dates expired (overdues)

sect2.title: Current loans
sect2.para: Current loans lists all items out on loan and enables you to print overdue notices or send overdue emails.
Below the results page, you can modify the number of search results to display on a page. To change it, just replace the default value with your own and click on Update.
You can customize the overdue email and the overdue notice in Administration (see the PMB Administrator's Guide).

To send an overdue email to a reader for a late return, click on the icon (not visible if the reader has no email address or the email address was not entered) . To display a print preview of an overdue notice, click on the icon.

sect2.title: Overdue items
sect2.para: Overdue items lists late returns sorted by readers and enables the printing of a customized overdue notice.
The letter is displayed in print preview in a pop-up window before printing.
You can also print all the overdue notices at once by clicking on Print all overdue notices.

sect2.title: Overdues by date
sect2.para: Overdue items by date lists all items overdue sorted by due date in ascending order, and enables the printing of a customized overdue notice. Earlier loans top the list.
You can also print all the overdue notices at once by clicking on Print all overdue notices.

sect1.title: Holds
sect1.para: Holds are managed from the Circulation tab. In the alert zone, bottom of screen, on the left, you will see messages alerting you of new holds placed by readers via the OPAC or by librarians.

The various status that you can consult in the Reporting tab, allows you to retrieve the works held from the shelves. Once they have been put aside, you can check in the Circulation tab the works corresponding to holds that you have just processed.

sect2.title: Holds
sect2.para: Displays the list of the works on which holds have been placed.
You can read the following information :

listitem.para: Title : the main title of the work held. The title is a link displaying the corresponding record together with the list of copies in the Catalogue tab. For more information on displaying records, consult the chapter Catalogue.

Borrower : displays the name of the reader who placed the hold. The borrower is a link displaying the reader's fiche in the Circulation tab. For more information on displaying a reader's fiche, consult Circulation , Loan items.

Return : scheduled due date or condition if at least one copy of the held document is available in the library. In this case, see below Reporting > Holds > to process, for a list of works held to be retrieved from the shelves.

Validity : the expiry date of the hold, as defined in Administration > Quotas if advanced quotas were defined; or in Administration > Items > media types. For more information on advanced quotas, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Quotas, or Items.

sect2.title: Holds to process
sect2.para: Displays the list of the holds remaining to be processes by the staff in charge.

For any unchecked hold : the references of available copies corresponding to the hold are displayed. If several holds were placed on a work and several copies are available, then the list displays all the holds that can be satisfied.
If no copy is available, the hold is displayed but without any reference to a corresponding copy.

With the list of holds to process in hand, walk through the shelves and remove the items from the shelves. Then check them in Circulation > Holds > current. For more information, consult the chapter Circulation, Holds.

sect2.title: Current borrowers
sect2.para: This screen allows you to start a borrower's search. By default the search displays all the borrowers.
To search for a reader, enter his/her name or the first letters of his/her name and click on OK.
Clicking on one of the readers in the search results displays his/her fiche in the Circulationtab.

At the bottom of the page, you can modify the number of results displayed per page. After modifying the number, click on Reload to apply the change. You can also export the results to Excel (left icon) or to an HTML table format for OpenOffice (right icon).

sect2.title: Borrowers : subscription near expiry
sect2.para: You can also display the borrowers whose subscription is about to lapse and the ones whose subscription has already expired.

PMB regards readers as having a subscription near expiry in relation to the renewal of membership letter. The delay is set in the PMB parameters. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Tools, Parameters.
To find a particular borrower with a subscription about to lapse, click on Reporting, Borrowers, subscription near expiry.
Then in the search results click on the borrower to display his/her fiche in the Circulation tab.

At the bottom of the page, you can modify the number of results displayed per page. After modifying the number, click on Reload to apply the change. You can also export the results to Excel (left icon) or to an HTML table format for OpenOffice (right icon).

sect2.title: Borrowers : subscription expired
sect2.para: Borrowers whose subscription has expired are not displayed in the current readers list.
You can display here the readers whose subscription has expired.
To find a borrower whose subscription has expired, click on Reporting, Borrowers, subscription expired.
Then in the search results click on the borrower to display his/her fiche in the Circulation tab.

At the bottom of the page, you can modify the number of results displayed per page. After modifying the number, click on Reload to apply the change. You can also export the results to Excel (left icon) or to an HTML table format for OpenOffice (right icon).

sect2.title: Serials list
sect2.para: This screen displays the number of copies per issue for each "parent" serial's record.
It enables you to check missing issues, for instance.
The first column indicates the issue number of the periodical (bulletin), the second one the publication date, and finally the number of copies in the catalogue.

sect2.title: Customized reports
sect2.para: This function of the Reporting tab enables you to display the results of stored procedures. These procedures are customizable in the Administration tab. They are written in SQL language and are processed by the ILS using PHP on which your server operates.
If you have loaded the test data set (data_test.sql, for more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Minimum data), you already have several customized reports at your disposal.
Several stored procedures are readily available. Their names are normally quite evocative. In case of doubt, run the procedure and look at the results to understand how it works.
To run a customized report, click on the report description. Whenever parameter values have to be specified, an intermediate screen will open.

figure.title: Reporting > Reports > customized, displaying the results of a customized report

sect2.para: At the bottom of the page, you can modify the number of results displayed per page. After modifying the number, click on Reload to apply the change. You can also export the results to Excel (left icon) or to an HTML table format for OpenOffice (right icon).

sect2.title: Auto creation
sect2.para: This tool allows you to generate barcodes for printing on labels leaflets.
To modify the labels layout click on Display then adjust the settings to suit your needs.

Choose high-quality labels and use a laserjet printer to improve their lifetime. Low-cost ink-jet printers use an ink that fades away quickly, and produce a print definition that is rather pale for barcode readers.
You can use a text file for the numbers you wish to print, personalize the name of your documentation center, etc.
The result is then displayed in an Acrobat window (PDF file generated by PMB).
You can preview the result, subsequently save it and print it.
